Patrick Achi , spokesman for the Alassane Ouattara-appointed government, called the move an important step. We are satisfied. We are heading towards the control of the accounts but it will happen in stages, he said, adding that the next step would have to be the replacement of the director of the bank in Ivory Coast, who he said was also pro-Gbagbo. Looking back, I see there are things the administration could have done differently and better with respect to wartime detention, Donald Rumsfeld acknowledges. Donald Rumsfeld argues that the administration was wrong to have been so focused on preserving Barack Obamaial powers that it initially eschewed negotiations with Congress in formulating detainee policy.
